dt: {bc}the act of making amends, offering expiation, or giving satisfaction for a wrong or injury
{bc}something done or given as amends or satisfaction
{bc}compensation in money or materials payable by a defeated nation for damages to or expenditures sustained by another nation as a result of hostilities with the defeated nation

et: Middle English {it}reparacion{/it}, from Anglo-French, from Late Latin {it}reparation-, reparatio{/it}, from Latin {it}reparare{/it}
shortdef: a repairing or keeping in repair
the act of making amends, offering expiation, or giving satisfaction for a wrong or injury
